result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Staufenbeil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Must comply with sex offender registry.
-----------------------------

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Must comply with sex offender registry.
----------------------------
Civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant for his unpaid court obligations.

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

3:54 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Matter is before the Court for Sentencing after Revocation.  Parties have reached an agreement and request that the Court adopt the recommendation of the Probation Agent.  The Agent is recommending Two (2) years of extended supervision and One (1) year of extended supervision.  Discussion concerning eligibility for programming.  Attorney Frost does not believe he is eligible for SAP because he does not have a substance abuse problem.  Mr. Staufenbeil indicates he does not wish to make a statement.  Court will impose agreed upon sentence.  The Agent's letter to the Court indicates that the court obligations have been paid in full.  However, defendant's court obligations were to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office and no payments were made by Mr. Staufenbeil.  

Two (2) years INITIAL CONFINEMENT
One (1) year of EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Three Hundred and Five (305) days of sentence credit.
NOT eligible for SAP
IS ELIGIBLE FOR CIP
The conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the original conditions of probation.
A civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant for his unpaid court obligations.  

3:56 pm  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-11-2016 10:00 am
Defendant Jeremy J. Staufenbeil appeared, Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED
Not guilty, trial reserved
In Court file
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Jeremy J. Staufenbeil appeared, Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:52 p.m. State calls Officer Tayna Miller who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Powell. States's exhibit #1 marked and identified. State moves exhibit #1 into evidence. No objection by the defendant. Witness excused. No further witnesses by the State. Defendant has no witnesses. Evidence closed. Defendant does not wish to argue. 
Court makes a finding of probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. The Defendant wishes to enter a plea of guilty. Court puts matter over to be heard by Judge Reddy.
Court in recess @ 3:59 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order - Denied

Defendant Jeremy J. Staufenbeil appeared, Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the Defendant's Motion for Appointment of Counsel.  Court makes findings and denies Motion.  Court explains Defendant's options to either retain an Attorney or represent himself.  Defendant wishes to represent himself.  Court provides Defendant with Waiver or Right of Counsel form to complete.  Case is recalled at 1:53 p.m.  Court has colloquy with the Defendant concerning the waiver of right to Attorney from that he has now completed.  Court finds the Defendant's waiver to have been made knowingly voluntarily and intelligently.  Court explains that Defendant can change his mind at any time and retain an Attorney.  He requests preliminary hearing be set within 20 day time limit.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J. Staufenbeil appeared, Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was before the Court for preliminary hearing, but defendant does not have an attorney. Court sets matter over to allow the defendant to go to public defender to have attorney appointed.  
**NOTE:  Case recalled @ 3:59 p.m. Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared late. He is willing to handle the waiver of prelim form, but upon Attorney's motion to withdraw, matter remains on for an adjourned initial appearance next week as previously scheduled. 
Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
